snippet: The officer was shot by gunmen on a motorcycle as she was dropping off relatives at school. Three others were wounded, including her daughter.
abstract: Two gunmen on a motorcycle shoot and kill a policewoman in western Afghanistan in fourth killing of an Afghan policewoman in last six months; female police officers, especially in Afghan's more rural areas, are extremely vulnerable, because there are so few of them that they are easily spotted, and because of an ingrained cultural resistance to women taking public roles.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Taimoor Shah contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The officer was shot by gunmen on a motorcycle as she was dropping off relatives at school. Three others were wounded, including her daughter.

headline.main: Afghan Policewoman Is Killed, Fourth in Last Six Months
